00020 template<typename T> T round_impl( double x, boost::mpl::bool_<true> )
00021 {
00022     const double ret( x < 0 ? x - 0.5 : x + 0.5 );
00023     return static_cast<T>( ret );
00024 }
00025 template<typename T> T round_impl( double x, boost::mpl::bool_<false> )
00026 {
00027     return static_cast<T>( x ); //@todo find a proper way to round from double to floating point (with range check !!)
00028 }
00029 template<typename T> T round( double x )
00030 {
00031     BOOST_MPL_ASSERT( ( boost::is_arithmetic<T> ) );
00032     return round_impl<T>( x, boost::mpl::bool_<std::numeric_limits<T>::is_integer>() ); //we do use overloading intead of (forbidden) partial specialization
00033 }

00035 size_t getConvertSize( const ValuePtrBase &src, const ValuePtrBase &dst );

00037 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count, double scale, double offset )
00038 {
00039     LOG( Runtime, info )
00040             << "using generic scaling convert " << ValuePtr<SRC>::staticName() << "=>" << ValuePtr<DST>::staticName()
00041             << " with scale/offset " << std::fixed << scale << "/" << offset;
00042 
00043     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ ) {
00044         dst[i] = round<DST>( src[i] * scale + offset );
00045     }
00046 }
00047 
00048 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const SRC *src, DST *dst, size_t count )
00049 {
00050     LOG( Runtime, info ) << "using generic convert " << ValuePtr<SRC>::staticName() << " => " << ValuePtr<DST>::staticName() << " without scaling";
00051 
00052     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ )
00053         dst[i] = round<DST>( src[i] );
00054 }
00055 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert_impl( const std::complex<SRC> *src, std::complex<DST> *dst, size_t count, double /*scale*/, double /*offset*/ )
00056 {
00057     LOG( Debug, error ) << "complex conversion with scaling is not yet supportet";
00058     numeric_convert_impl( src, dst, count );
00059 }
00060 
00061 template<typename T> void numeric_copy_impl( const T *src, T *dst, size_t count )
00062 {
00063     LOG( Runtime, info )    << "using memcpy-copy of " << ValuePtr<T>::staticName() << " without scaling";
00064     memcpy( dst, src, count * sizeof( T ) );
00065 }
00066 template<typename T> void numeric_copy_impl( const T *src, T *dst, size_t count, double scale, double offset )
00067 {
00068     LOG( Runtime, info )    << "using generic scaling copy of " << ValuePtr<T>::staticName() << " with scale/offset " << std::fixed << scale << "/" << offset;
00069 
00070     for ( size_t i = 0; i < count; i++ )
00071         dst[i] = src[i] * scale + offset;
00072 }

00196 
00214 template<typename SRC, typename DST> std::pair<double, double>
00215 getNumericScaling( const util::_internal::ValueBase &min, const util::_internal::ValueBase &max, autoscaleOption scaleopt = autoscale )
00216 {
00217     double scale = 1.0;
00218     double offset = 0.0;
00219     bool doScale = ( scaleopt != noscale && std::numeric_limits<DST>::is_integer ); //only do scale if scaleopt!=noscale and the target is an integer (scaling into float is useless)
00220 
00221     if ( scaleopt == autoscale && std::numeric_limits<SRC>::is_integer ) {
00222         LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Won't upscale, because the source datatype is discrete (" << util::Value<SRC>::staticName() << ")";
00223         scaleopt = noupscale; //dont scale up if SRC is an integer
00224     }
00225 
00226     if ( doScale ) {
00227         const DST domain_min = std::numeric_limits<DST>::min();//negative value domain of this dst [min .. -1]
00228         const DST domain_max = std::numeric_limits<DST>::max();//positive value domain of this dst [0 .. max]
00229         double minval, maxval;
00230         minval = min.as<double>();
00231         maxval = max.as<double>();
00232         assert( minval < maxval );
00233         LOG( Debug, info ) << "src Range:" << minval << "=>" << maxval;
00234         LOG( Debug, info ) << "dst Domain:" << static_cast<double>( domain_min ) << "=>" << static_cast<double>( domain_max );
00235         assert( domain_min < domain_max );//we also should assume this
00236 
00237         //set offset for src
00238         //if all src is completly on positive domain, or if there is no negative domain use minval
00239         //else if src is completly on negative dmain, or if there is no positive domain use maxval
00240         //elsewise leave it at 0 and scale both sides
00241         if ( minval > 0 || !domain_min ) {
00242             //          if ( ( maxval - domain_max ) > 0 ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00243             offset = -minval;
00244         } else if ( ( 0 - maxval ) > 0 || !domain_max ) {
00245             //          if ( ( domain_min - minval ) > 0  ) // if the values completely fit into the domain we dont have to offset them
00246             offset = -maxval;
00247         }
00248 
00249         //calculate range of values which will be on postive/negative domain when offset is applied
00250         const double range_max = maxval + offset; //allways >=0
00251         const double range_min = minval + offset; //allways <=0
00252         //set scaling factor to fit src-range into dst domain
00253         //some compilers dont make x/0 = inf, so we use std::numeric_limits<double>::max() instead, in this case
00254         const double scale_max =
00255             range_max != 0 ? domain_max / range_max :
00256             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00257         const double scale_min =
00258             range_min != 0 ? domain_min / range_min :
00259             std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
00260         scale = std::min( scale_max ? scale_max : std::numeric_limits<double>::max(), scale_min ? scale_min : std::numeric_limits<double>::max() );//get the smaller scaling factor which is not zero so the bigger range will fit into his domain
00261 
00262         if ( scale < 1 ) {
00263             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Downscaling your values by Factor " << scale << " you might lose information.";
00264         } else if ( scaleopt == noupscale ) {
00265             if ( scale > 1 ) {
00266                 LOG( Runtime, info ) << "upscale not given, clamping scale " << scale << " to 1";
00267                 scale = 1;
00268             }
00269         }
00270 
00271         if( scale == 1 ) {
00272             if( ( minval - domain_min ) > 0 && ( domain_max - maxval ) > 0 )
00273                 offset = 0; // if the source does fit into the domain, and we do not scale - we wont need an offset
00274         } else
00275             offset *= scale;//calc offset for dst
00276     }
00277 
00278     return std::make_pair( scale, offset );
00279 }
00280 
00296 template<typename SRC, typename DST> void numeric_convert( const ValuePtr<SRC> &src, ValuePtr<DST> &dst, const double scale, const double offset )
00297 {
00298     const size_t size = _internal::getConvertSize( src, dst );
00299 
00300     if ( ( scale != 1. || offset ) )
00301         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size, scale, offset );
00302     else
00303         _internal::numeric_convert_impl( &src[0], &dst[0], size );
00304 }
00305 template<typename T> void numeric_copy( const ValuePtr<T> &src, ValuePtr<T> &dst, const double scale, const double offset )
00306 {
00307     const size_t size = _internal::getConvertSize( src, dst );
00308 
00309     if ( ( scale != 1. || offset ) )
00310         _internal::numeric_copy_impl<T>( &src[0], &dst[0], size, scale, offset );
00311     else
00312         _internal::numeric_copy_impl<T>( &src[0], &dst[0], size );
00313 }
00314 
00315 }
